snippet.title: Facebook tweaks its privacy settings
snippet.description:
* Everyone has that friend or family member who unwittingly still posts publicly on Facebook. It's not that they're over-sharers, they just haven't bothered to keep up with the social network's ever-changing and often confusing privacy settings.
http://www.cnn.com/2014/04/08/tech/social-media/facebook-privacy-adjustments/index.html

snippet.title: I'd pay Facebook if it can give me privacy
snippet.description:
* Like most couples, my wife and I were discussing marriage before we officially got engaged. But we discovered that we could not keep our private information private. Once we started discussing engagement rings in (supposedly) private Facebook messages to each other, my Web browser became inundated with engagement ring adv...
http://www.cnn.com/2014/03/10/opinion/wheeler-facebook-privacy/index.html

snippet.title: Facebook Home, privacy and you
snippet.description:
* Facebook and online privacy: For several years now, it's been hard to talk about one without talking about the other.
http://www.cnn.com/2013/04/05/tech/social-media/facebook-home-privacy/index.html

snippet.title: All is well after Zuckerberg photo flap
snippet.description:
* The sister of Facebook CEO Mark Zuckerberg says there are no hard feelings after a "leaked" family photo raised questions about online etiquette and privacy on the social network.
http://www.cnn.com/2012/12/27/tech/social-media/randi-zuckerberg-photo/index.html

snippet.title: Privacy worries go far beyond e-mails
snippet.description:
* Facebook recently announced new privacy controls that enable users not only to limit how their information is shared, but also to better understand how that information is exposed to others. Increased transparency and strong, simple privacy controls like these are prac...
http://www.cnn.com/2012/12/21/opinion/anthony-privacy/index.html

snippet.title: How did viral Facebook privacy hoax capitalize on privacy fears?
snippet.description:
* Something about the Facebook privacy hoax has gotten people to click "share."
http://www.cnn.com/2012/11/27/tech/social-media/facebook-privacy-hoax/index.html

snippet.title: 'Facebook parenting' is destroying our children's privacy
snippet.description:
* Today's 30-somethings are the first generation whose children are coming of age alongside the social Web.
http://www.cnn.com/2012/05/25/opinion/sultan-miller-facebook-parenting/index.html

snippet.title: Despite Facebook, privacy is far from dead
snippet.description: * Whatever the outcome of Facebook's public offering of stock, the social network has already enriched quite a few ? as well as famously offered many hundreds of millions of people a new virtual social world. Yet critics claim that Facebook is hastening the demise of privacy http://www.cnn.com/2012/05/25/opinion/etzioni-facebook-privacy/index.html

snippet.title: What scares Facebook: Privacy and phones
snippet.description:
* Like a good friend, Facebook says it doesn't want to invade our privacy or hang out with folks who spend all their time looking at a cell phone.
http://www.cnn.com/2012/02/01/tech/social-media/facebook-ipo-risks/index.html
